```{r}
library(tidyverse)
```

## Problem 1

Create a data frame with the specific elements

```{r create_df}
prob1_df = 
  tibble(
    samp = rnorm(10),
    samp_gt_0 = samp > 0,
    char_vec = c("a", "b", "c", "d", "e", "f", "g", "h", "i", "j"),
    factor_vec = factor(c("low", "low", "low", "mod", "mod", "mod", "mod", "high", "high", "high"))
  )
```


 Take the mean of each variable in my data frame. 

```{r mean_pull_var}
mean(pull(prob1_df, samp))
mean(pull(prob1_df, samp_gt_0))
mean(pull(prob1_df, char_vec))
mean(pull(prob1_df, factort_vec))
```

Take mean of numbers 

```{r}
as.numeric(pull(prob1_df, samp))
as.numeric(pull(prob1_df, samp_gt_0))
as.numeric(pull(prob1_df, char_vec))
as.numeric(pull(prob1_df, factort_vec))
```

```{r}
head(penguins)
```

```{r}
ggplot(penguins, aes(x = bill_length_mm, y = flipper_length_mm)) + geom_point(aes(color = species))
```



```{r}
penguins = tibble(
  x = bill_length_mm 
  y = flipper_length_mm,
)
ggplot(penguins, aes(x = x)) + geom_histogram()


ggplot(penguins, aes(x = x, y = y)) + geom_point()
```
